Contribute

If you have questions, feature requests or find any bugs in adadmire, please create a corresponding issue at gitlab.spang-lab.de/bul38390/admire/issues.

If you want to write code for this package, please also create an Issue first, describing your planned code contribution. After your proposal is accepted by an active maintainer of the repository, you will receive permissions to create branches. Then, follow these steps, based on this tutorial:

Steps:

  1. Make your code changes

  2. Increase the version in pyproject.toml

  3. Build the package: - Install build and twine modules: python -m pip install --upgrade build twine - Build your package: python -m build

  4. Upload to PyPI Test Server (optional): - Upload your package: python -m twine upload --repository testpypi dist/* - Check test.pypi.org/project/adadmire - Test installation: python -m pip install --upgrade --index-url https://test.pypi.org/simple/ --no-deps adadmire

  5. Upload to PyPI Production Server: - Upload your package: python -m twine upload dist/* - Check pypi.org/project/adadmire - Test installation: python -m pip install --upgrade adadmire

All commands in short

python -m pip install --upgrade build twine wheel
rm dist/*
python -m build
python -m pip install ./dist/adadmire-*-py3-none-any.whl
python -m twine upload --repository testpypi dist/*
python -m pip install --upgrade --index-url https://test.pypi.org/simple/ --no-deps adadmire
python -m twine upload dist/*
python -m pip install --upgrade adadmire

Tips and Tricks

Create a .pypirc file

Create a .pypirc file with following content in your local home directory to avoid typing your PyPI username and password each time.

[testpypi]
repository = https://test.pypi.org/legacy/
username = <my_test_pypi_username>
password = <my_test_pypi_password>

[pypi]
repository = https://upload.pypi.org/legacy/
username = <my_pypi_username>
password = <my_pypi_password>
